p: Plants have been demonstrated to be an attractive alternative to mammalian cell cultures as a system for mAb development and production (Chen and Davis, 2016). mAbs produced in Nicotiana benthamiana have been developed as candidates to treat various viral infections including those caused by West Nile virus (WNV) (Sun et al., 2018), dengue virus (DENV) (Dent et al., 2016) and, of prominence, using a cocktail of three mAbs to treat Ebola virus‐infected human patients (PREVAIL Group, 2016). For example, we have demonstrated that a single dose of an anti‐WNV mAb produced in N. benthamiana and lettuce plants protected mice from lethal infection of WNV, even given 4 days post‐infection (dpi) when virus already circulates in the brain (He et al., 2014; Lai et al., 2010, 2012, 2014).
